content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 31 Mar 2019Are there any hedge funds in Singapore for Retail investors? If there are, how can we invest in them?2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Cedric Jamie Soh, Director at Seniorcare.com.sgTop Contributor (Sep)Level 7. Grand MasterAnswered on 02 Sep 2019I won't recommend hedge funds. Most hedge funds do not outperform the stock market enough to justify the high fees.Most people using ETF or index investing has higher returns than hedge funds. Google for an ideal ETF or index that suits you more.0 comments2

Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 31 Mar 2019Very few for non accredited investors. But for those available, most of them have a minimum of 50k to 100k to invest.Or you might need to use an ILP to access them.0 comments0
